--------------030704010406080808030209
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="ISO-8859-1"; format=flowed
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit

We are experiencing difficulty maintaining good bandwidth utilization 
with Heritrix similar to what Dereck Pappas described in an earlier message:

http://tech.groups.yahoo.com/group/archive-crawler/message/6353

We are running Heritrix on a 155-Mbps link to the Internet, and we have 
tried both H1 and H3 with no significant change in bandwidth 
utilization. As described in the message referenced above, a crawl 
starts out making sort of OK utilization (3 Mbps per crawling machine) 
but then gradually drops down to only a few kilobits/second. We tried 
tweaking the "politeness" settings in Heritrix, but that still did not 
help keep utilization from dropping to the kilobit/second scale. We have 
been experimenting with seed lists with as many as 10,000 and even 
100,000 entries per list. I am attaching a copy of the H1 order.xml we 
typically use.

Any suggestions on how to get Heritrix to maintain better bandwidth 
utilization are appreciated.

-- 
Youssef Eldakar
Bibliotheca Alexandrina
